faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What is a nominee shareholder in the UAE?
items.answer: A nominee shareholder is an appointed UAE local or entity that holds shares on your behalf, ensuring your name doesn't appear on public company records.

items.question: How long does it take to appoint a nominee shareholder?
items.answer: Our seamless onboarding process connects you with the best-fit nominee shareholder in 2-5 business days, accelerating your market entry.

items.question: Can nominee shareholders interfere with my company's decision-making?
items.answer: No, business owners remain the beneficial owners of their company, meaning you retain 100% control over profits and decision-making power.

items.question: Will my personal and business information stay confidential with One Nexuz?
items.answer: Yes, our experts ensure your identity, documents, and agreements remain secure through stringent confidentiality protocols and digital encryption.

items.question: Is it legal to use nominee shareholder services in the UAE?
items.answer: Yes, nominee shareholder services are fully legal and widely used by foreign expatriates, as long as you secure your nominee service agreement, Power of Attorney, and declaration of trust.
